intro: Mentzelia congesta, commonly known as the clustered mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is known for its ability to tolerate drought conditions. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths.
